textual_report:
BioHumanGene2

The undirected graph BioHumanGene2 has 14340 nodes and 9041364 edges.

RAM requirements

The RAM requirements for the nodes and edges data structures are 2.31MB and 13.08MB respectively.

Degree centrality

The minimum node degree is 1, the maximum node degree is 7229, the mode degree is 1, the mean degree is 1260.00 and the node degree median is 750.

The nodes with highest degree centrality are: 209 (degree 7229 and weighted degree 7229), 646 (degree 6857 and weighted degree 6857), 3369 (degree 6834 and weighted degree 6834), 3732 (degree 6765 and weighted degree 6765) and 853 (degree 6709 and weighted degree 6709).

Disconnected nodes

Disconnected nodes are nodes that are not connected to any other node.The graph contains 318 disconnected nodes.

Singleton nodes with selfloops

Singleton nodes with selfloops are nodes with no edge to other nodes and have exclusively selfloops. The graph contains 318 singleton nodes with selfloops, which are 1 (degree 1 and weighted degree 1), 2 (degree 1 and weighted degree 1), 3 (degree 1 and weighted degree 1), 4 (degree 1 and weighted degree 1) and 5 (degree 1 and weighted degree 1), plus other 313 singleton nodes with selfloops.

Weights

The minimum edge weight is 0.03000039, the maximum edge weight is 1 and the total edge weight is 769901.4362787269.

Weighted degree centrality

The minimum node degree is 1.00, the maximum node degree is 369.74, the mean degree is 53.69 and the node degree median is 29.989751778542995.

The nodes with highest degree centrality are: 209 (degree 7229 and weighted degree 7229), 5746 (degree 6225 and weighted degree 6225), 853 (degree 6709 and weighted degree 6709), 3732 (degree 6765 and weighted degree 6765) and 8197 (degree 6295 and weighted degree 6295).

RAM requirements

The RAM requirements for the edge weights data structure is 72.27MB.
